history.content:
Regarding 162 as a prereq for 168, this has already been discussed many times: @144, @439, @1002, @1157, @1543

Otherwise, I don't think your situation really warrants a different schedule than any other student who is first taking upper divs? Other than perhaps you might want an easier schedule, except it seems like you already have an idea of what a schedule you want?

---

If you haven't worked on CS for a while I would definitely take 188 for one of the courses. The workload is one of the lightest of the upper-div CS classes and it does not demand sharp mathematical or programming skills to the same degree that, say, 170 or 186 do.

Regarding 162 as a prereq for 168, this has already been discussed many times: @144, @439, @1002, @1157, @1543

Otherwise, I don't think your situation really warrants a different schedule than any other student who is first taking upper divs? Other than perhaps you might want an easier schedule, except it seems like you already have an idea of what a schedule you want?

Hi,

I am currently taking this semester off and will be coming back Fall 2017. I have completed all lower division courses before my gap semester but haven't worked on CS at all since then. So I am wondering which two out of 168, 170, 186, 188 should I take for my first two upper div courses? I saw that 162 is a prereq for 168 but I heard that people do not need 162 to take 168. Is it true? 

Any thoughts would be appreciated.

Thanks!
history.subject: Choosing two out of CS 168, 170, 188, and 186
